title: New York City to Crack Down on Abuse of Parking Privileges
summary: The goal is to curb illegal parking by city employees and other drivers who use placards to avoid being ticketed. New York City will phase out its parking placard program for city employees and replace it with a high-tech system in an effort to curb abuse.

title: Coast Guard Officer Amassed an Arsenal
summary: Authorities found components used to make 'ghost guns' that are untraceable. GREENBELT, Maryland-A U.S. Coast Guard lieutenant arrested last week who federal authorities say was planning a domestic terrorist attack had amassed an arsenal of firearms and gun components used to fabricate untraceable home-built weapons.

title: Venezuelan Official Breaks With Maduro
summary: Hugo Carvajal, the former military-intelligence chief, pledges support for opposition leader Juan Guaidó and says humanitarian aid should be let into the country. The former chief of Venezuela's military intelligence broke with President Nicolás Maduro on Thursday and pledged his support for U.S.-backed opposition leader Juan Guaidó amid a deepening political crisis in the South American nation.

title: Pioneer Natural Resources CEO Retires Abruptly
summary: Texas shale company says former Chief Executive Scott Sheffield to retake helm. The chief executive of shale oil and gas driller Pioneer Natural Resources Co. has retired, effective immediately, the company said Thursday.

title: U.S. Dollar Rises as China Trade Deadline Nears
summary: The dollar posts gains against currencies whose value is typically related to commodity prices. The U.S. dollar rose Thursday amid concerns about global growth from investors as trade talks between the U.S. and China are nearing a deadline when the U.S. could impose higher tariffs.

title: Disharmony at Broadway Shows Over Musicians' Roles
summary: Union says two men can't perform in 'Be More Chill' and 'Hadestown' because they also orchestrated the music. A musicians' union is challenging the employment of two members scheduled to perform in high-profile Broadway shows this season, saying their involvement with the productions goes against the current labor agreement.

title: IRS Analyst Charged With Leaking Michael Cohen Bank Records
summary: Former Trump lawyer's records showed financial transactions that were flagged as suspicious. Federal prosecutors have charged an Internal Revenue Service analyst in San Francisco with illegally disclosing the confidential banking information of Michael Cohen, President Trump's former personal lawyer.

title: North Carolina Calls for New Vote in House Race Marred by Tampering Allegations
summary: Move comes after Republican Mark Harris said evidence of ballot tampering by his campaign convinced him a new election is needed. RALEIGH, N.C.-North Carolina election officials voted unanimously Thursday to hold a new election for the state's Ninth Congressional District, after Republican candidate Mark Harris said evidence of ballot tampering by his campaign had convinced him one was needed.

title: Nintendo of America President Is Retiring
summary: Doug Bowser, senior vice president of sales and marketing in the U.S. division, to succeed him. Nintendo Co. said Thursday that Reggie Fils-Aimé, its longtime president of the U.S. division, is retiring in April.

title: Wooden Beam Falls From Elevated Subway Line in Queens, Impales Car
summary: No one was hurt in the incident; MTA is investigating. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority launched an investigation Thursday, after a wooden beam fell from an elevated subway track in Queens, impaling the passenger side of a moving car.

title: Zillow, in Leadership Shuffle, Brings Back Former CEO
summary: Rich Barton returns to the helm, succeeding fellow co-founder, Spencer Rascoff. Zillow Group Inc. is bringing back its former chief executive to lead the company again.

title: Prosecutors Broke the Law in Jeffrey Epstein Case, Judge Rules
summary: Justice Department violated 2004 law by making a plea deal with Florida financier and not conferring with alleged victims. A judge ruled Thursday that federal prosecutors overseeing the Jeffrey Epstein sexual-abuse case-including current Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta-violated the law by concealing from his underage alleged victims the existence of a plea deal that shielded the politically connected Florida financier from federal charges.

title: Dropbox Is Still a Work in Progress
summary: Dropbox is upgrading its user base, but not rapidly enough. Users like Dropbox , but not all of them are willing to pay up for it.

title: Departing Caesars CEO to Stay Longer, as Revenue Increases
summary: Company continues search for Mark Frissora's successor. Caesars Entertainment Corp. , which is being pushed to consider a sale by activist investor Carl Icahn, reported that revenue rose in the latest quarter and its departing chief executive will stay on longer than expected.

title: Samuels Jewelers Laundered Money in Indian Bank Fraud, Probe Finds
summary: U.S. retailer used shell companies, sham deals to shuffle millions of dollars in cash and diamonds, report says. A court-appointed investigator said he has found evidence that Samuels Jewelers, a century-old U.S. retail chain that filed for bankruptcy last year, laundered money as part of an alleged $2 billion fraud on India's Punjab National Bank .

title: Zion Williamson's Ripped Sneaker Puts Nike in a Bad Spot
summary: Sneakers have malfunctioned before, but never under such a spotlight. Nike Inc. may be living through a brand's worst nightmare.

title: AT&T Gives 3G Service Three Years to Live
summary: AT&T and rival Verizon both plan to stop serving 3G devices in coming years to make room for newer and more efficient wireless standards. The days of using a 3G cellphone in the U.S. are numbered.

title: Bank of Canada Says Timing of Rate Rises Uncertain
summary: Central bank governor says Canada's labor market is strong, but the trade outlook is clouded with risks. MONTREAL-Bank of Canada governor Stephen Poloz said Thursday that interest rates will need to move higher to keep inflation in check, but the timing of future increases remains unclear as policy makers grapple with mixed messages about the country's economic outlook.

title: Congress to Weigh Measures to Nullify Trump's Emergency Order
summary: Senate passage would require GOP lawmakers to break ranks. WASHINGTON-Congress is set to begin considering resolutions to nullify President Trump's emergency order for a wall along the southern border next week, though the need for Republican support in the Senate makes for a tough road to passage.

title: CEO at Maker of Sharpie, Rubbermaid Under Board Pressure
summary: Directors have discussed finding new leader for Newell Brands while dangling long-term stock awards for Michael Polk. Newell Brands Inc. Chief Executive Michael Polk is under pressure from the board of directors to prove his turnaround is working following several disappointing quarters of sales at the household-goods conglomerate, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: SoftBank's Vision Fund Leads $1 Billion Funding Round for Shipping Broker Flexport
summary: Company arranges shipments using technology that mirrors travel-booking websites Expedia and Priceline. SoftBank Group Corp.'s Vision Fund is diving into the global freight business, leading a new $1 billion round of funding in Flexport Inc., a six-year-old international shipping broker built by Silicon Valley technology developers.

title: Tax Law Helped Boost 2018 Bank Profits to Record Level
summary: No bank failed last year, the first time that has happened since 2006, though FDIC says the good times can't last. WASHINGTON-The new tax law drove double-digit profit growth at U.S. banks last year, a federal regulator said Thursday, boosting the industry's earnings, which would have hit a record even without the tax changes.

title: Some European Executives Start Cutting Costs as Economy Slows While Others Wait
summary: Trade tensions, Brexit and lower demand cloud the outlook for European companies. Trade tensions, slower economic growth and Britain's looming exit from the European Union are denting the outlook for companies in Europe-forcing some to make structural changes while others take a wait-and-see approach.

title: President Trump Is Right: There Is a Border Emergency
summary: Donald Trump was elected on a platform of protecting the country from just such an invasion.. Regarding your editorials "Trump's Political Emergency" (Feb. 15) and "Presidents and Guardrails" (Feb. 16): So what is a president to do when our border, language and culture are under assault? Donald Trump was elected on a platform of protecting the country from such an invasion. Both he and our elected representatives swore an oath to enforce these laws. Against immense opposition, it's no wonder President Trump is left with the emergency powers route.

title: Judge Orders Roger Stone to Avoid Further Comment on Pending Trial
summary: Judge cites risk of violence in imposing gag order on longtime Trump adviser. WASHINGTON-A federal judge on Thursday ordered longtime Trump adviser Roger Stone to avoid any further comment about his pending criminal trial after he posted a photo of the judge with what appeared to be crosshairs next to her head.

title: Beto or Not, the Republican Market Share Is Eroding
summary: Republicans have been losing market share at the rate of 2% per presidential election cycle since the late 1980s.. Daniel Henninger writes of the Democrats' need for a candidate who can stand toe to toe with President Trump on the campaign trail ("Maybe It'll Be Beto," Wonder Land, Feb. 14). That may be helpful, but all the Democrats really need are more voters, and the party is on track to gain them.

title: Blame Congress, not the VA, for Hero 'Non-Veterans'
summary: This requires Congressional repair. The VA can't change the rules unilaterally. It would also help if the military stopped issuing bad paper for soldiers with PTSD.. Rose Carmen Goldberg's "He Has a Purple Heart, but the VA Wouldn't Call Him a Veteran" (op-ed, Feb. 13), regarding the denial of veteran status to a discharged soldier with "bad paper," illustrates a situation which is in sore need of correction. The headline, however, misplaces the blame.

title: New York's Boondoggle LED Program Is Self-Satirizing
summary: New York City would be better served to give LEDs away and hope they find their way into light sockets.. Regarding your editorial "$1,973 LEDs and the Green New Deal" (Feb. 16): Milton Friedman once said, "If a private enterprise is a failure, it closes down-unless it can get a government subsidy to keep it going; if a government enterprise fails, it is expanded." This is the basic flaw of the New Green Deal. Left unchecked, the government can and will go to any length to prove its point, and the cost to our society will make $1,973 LEDs look like a drop in the bucket.

title: Venezuelan Oil Supplies Hit Five-Year High as Buyers Become Elusive
summary: U.S. sanctions, announced Jan. 28, are stifling crude sales and could continue to drive up oil prices. Venezuela's oil inventories have climbed to their highest levels in at least five years, according to satellite data, a sign that U.S. sanctions are stifling sales and could continue to drive up global prices.

title: New York City Development Chief Faults Amazon for Scuttled HQ2 Deal
summary: Amazon 'never hired a single New Yorker' to talk to New Yorkers, James Patchett said. 'They never really connected with people in the city'. A top New York City official who helped draft the deal to build an Amazon.com Inc. campus in Queens blamed the company for the project's collapse, saying it did a poor job connecting with residents and communicating the economic benefits to the state.

title: 'Ministry of Evil: The Twisted Cult of Tony Alamo' Review: Hell on Earth
summary: A documentary series tells the story of Tony and Susan Alamo, whose Alamo Christian Foundation depended on its members' unshakable faith in the divinity of their leaders.. This four-part documentary series about fire-and-brimstone preachers and their worshipful cult has a familiar look, as it should. The story revealed in extraordinarily raw detail in "Ministry of Evil: The Twisted Cult of Tony Alamo" (begins Wednesday, 11 p.m., SundanceTV) had its start in the 1960s and continued through the '70s, '80s, '90s and beyond. But it's the 1960s, when the cult first takes root among the flower children of San Francisco, that the tone of this history is set-and an evocative picture it is of the era when hordes of dreamy wanderers poured into Haight-Ashbury vaguely in search of something new in life in addition to dropping acid.

title: Immigrant Deportations Climb 150% in Two Years in New York City
summary: Comptroller report shows Chinese immigrants largest group affected, followed by Indian immigrants. Arrests and deportations in New York City by federal immigration officials rose sharply in the past two years, according to a report released Thursday by the city's comptroller's office.

title: U.S. Stocks End Lower on Disappointing Data, Earnings
summary: Investors await the outcome of the latest round of U.S.-China trade talks. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell more than 100 points Thursday, pressured by disappointing readings on the state of the U.S. and European economies.

title: On the Ballot in Nigeria: How to Manage Oil Money
summary: Voters to judge presidential candidates, in part, on their plans to revive a vital industry. When Nigerians vote for their next president on Saturday, they face a choice between two candidates with different visions for the oil sector, which accounts for more than half of the government's revenue.

title: Apax Sells Majority Stake in Insurance Brokerage AssuredPartners Back to GTCR
summary: GTCR previously sold the insurance brokerage to Apax in 2015. Private-equity firm GTCR is leading a deal to buy insurance brokerage AssuredPartners Inc., a little less than four years after selling the company to Apax Partners.

title: AT&T Joins Latest Brand Pullback From YouTube Over 'Unsafe' Content
summary: Telecom was among marketers that returned after a prior brand revolt. AT&T Inc. is the latest to join a growing group of marketers halting their advertising on YouTube after it was found that the site served ads near inappropriate content again, putting pressure on the video platform to contain any new brand revolt.

title: Massive Fire in Bangladesh's Capital Kills at Least 70 People
summary: Inferno began in an apartment block where chemicals used to make cosmetics were stored. A fire swept through a mixed residential and commercial area of Bangladesh's capital, leaving dozens dead and renewing concerns over industrial safety in one of the world's most densely populated cities.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended Feb. 16
summary: With data from NPD BookScan. NPD BookScan gathers point-of-sale book data from more than 16,000 locations across the U.S., representing about 85% of the nation's book sales. Print-book data providers include all major booksellers, web retailers and food stores. E-book data providers include all major e-book retailers. Free e-books and those selling for less than 99 cents are excluded from the ebook lists. The fiction and nonfiction combined lists include aggregated sales for all book formats (except audio books, bundles, boxed sets and foreign language editions) and feature a combination of adult, young adult and juvenile titles. The hardcover fiction and nonfiction lists also encompass a mix of adult, young adult and juvenile titles while the business list features only adult hardcover titles. Refer questions to Teresa.Vozzo@wsj.com.

title: Adam McKay Wants to Start a World-Improvement Conference
summary: The director, nominated for three Oscars for his Dick Cheney biopic, Vice, may have started his career with improv slapstick, but his real interest these days is for thorny, geopolitical debates. Ahead of This Giant Beast That Is the Global Economy, his new Amazon show, McKay talks about his (divisive) next movie subject, the whirl of Oscars weekend and why he may never go back to mainstream comedy. Shortly after dropping out of Temple University, Adam McKay drove to Chicago to study improvisational comedy. There, he co-founded the scrappy improv troupe Upright Citizens Brigade, which became known for producing some of Chicago's edgiest theater. (One skit involved McKay advertising his own suicide.) It was a deliciously preposterous, taboo-busting brand of art that revelled in the absurdity of everyday life and exposed the often paper-thin veil between comedy and tragedy.

title: Who Needs Gender? Why Men and Women Are Dressing Identically
summary: Unisex style is rising, but are separate men's and women's clothing lines really a thing of the past-and what does the gender-neutral revolution mean for you?. "MEN'S" AND "WOMEN'S" categories still occupy the navigation menu on the website for 10-year-old retailer Totokaelo. Yet shoppers have increasingly crossed these virtual gender lines, said Fanny Damiette, vice president of brand and marketing for its parent company, Richmond, Va.-based NSTO. "We have data that shows that sometimes the girls will go in the men's section and the men will go in the women's section." The shop leans into this fluidity, hiring transgender and nonbinary models and putting menswear in the women's section.

title: Treasurys Pull Back After Recent Gains
summary: Optimism about U.S.-China trade talks hurt demand. U.S. government bonds pulled back Thursday as optimism about U.S.-China trade talks helped depress demand from investors.

title: Dressing Alike is Nothing New
summary: These notable couples-romantic and otherwise-donned identical outfits in different eras. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Netanyahu Rivals Team Up Against the Prime Minister for Israel's Elections
summary: Centrist candidates strike an alliance in a bid to unseat the prime minister. TEL AVIV-Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's two main rivals are joining forces for April's elections, a move that poses a serious challenge to the right-wing leader's bid for a record fifth term.

title: Treasury Inflation Bond Auction Sees Strong Demand
summary: Response shows some investors see potential for consumer prices to rise. The Treasury's auction of $8 billion in 30-year inflation-protected bonds Thursday met with strong demand, a sign that some investors see potential for consumer prices to rise.

title: Oil Prices Decline as U.S. Crude Production Hits Record
summary: Energy Information Administration reports crude inventories rose last week to 455 million barrels. • U.S. oil prices declined slightly Thursday as domestic production hit a record and oil inventories climbed to their highest level since November 2017.

title: Tesla's Model 3 Loses Recommended Status From Consumer Reports
summary: The electric-car maker's newest plug-in model had reported problems with loose body trim and glass defects, product-review magazine says. Tesla Inc.'s Model 3 sedan lost its coveted "recommended" status from influential product reviewer Consumer Reports less than a year after it was awarded, raising questions about the quality of the vehicle as the electric-car maker rushed to increase production.

title: Gold Falls With Treasury Yields, Dollar Climbing
summary: The Fed reiterates plans to stay cautious with interest rates and its balance-sheet runoff program, a potential positive for bullish gold investors. Gold prices pulled back from a 10-month high Thursday, hurt by rising Treasury yields and a stronger dollar as analysts weighed a number of economic data points and awaited an update on U.S.-China trade talks.

title: 'How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World' Review: More Smoke Than Fire
summary: The final film in the trilogy sees the same gorgeous animation and beloved characters return, but something else is missing.. The graphics are gorgeous in "How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World"-even more so than in earlier iterations of the franchise, which means a surfeit of spectacular images from top-of-the-line computer animation. And the love story branches out beyond a boy and his dragon into gladdening fulfillment on both sides of the species divide. That will certainly be sufficient for kids and families who've been waiting for the final chapter of the big-screen trilogy. Over much of the territory it covers, though, the film feels like it's flying on empty.

title: Huawei to Increase Canadian Staff by 20%
summary: The Chinese company will increase Canadian R&D spending by 15% and cede some ownership of Canadian intellectual property to local universities. Huawei Technologies Co. said it would hire 200 new employees and increase research and development spending in Canada as the Chinese company attempts to counter U.S. efforts to pressure allies to abandon its equipment over security concerns.

summary: Inside two homes that are currently on the market on Chicago's North Shore.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: 'The Shadow of a Gunman' Review: A Play Filled With Politics That Doesn't Get Political
summary: The first part of Seán O'Casey's Dublin Trilogy, set during the height of the Irish War of Independence, is a tragedy disguised as a comedy..

title: No One Remembers That Other Nike Shoe Failure
summary: Long-forgotten problems with Eliud Kipchoge's shoes likely cost him a world record in the 2015 Berlin Marathon. A celebrated athlete was wearing Nike shoes at a high-profile event and then the unthinkable happened: His footwear malfunctioned.

title: Cohen Will Testify to Senate Intelligence Committee Tuesday
summary: Former Trump lawyer will make three congressional appearances next week. WASHINGTON-Michael Cohen will testify privately next week before the Senate Intelligence Committee, a person close to him said, one of three congressional appearances next week for the former Trump lawyer who has implicated the president in federal crimes.

title: Unusual Alliance Leads Congestion-Pricing Movement
summary: Big real-estate developers, Uber, labor and environmental groups push for plan as New York budget talks progress. The push for congestion pricing in New York has created a coalition of strange bedfellows, and its biggest funders-major real-estate developers and Uber Technologies Inc.-are planning a final blitz as state budget negotiations intensify.

title: Need More Kitchen Storage? Roll In a Library Ladder
summary: Designers are importing rolling ladders-which evoke romantic rooms devoted to bibliophilia-into kitchens to stylishly access new stash space. It's every reader's fantasy: curled up like an otter on a Chesterfield sofa in front of a fragrant fire, getting lost in Austen or Auden. The setting? A moody mahogany library lined with cases of books so towering you need a rolling ladder to reach the top shelves.

title: How to Cold-Weather-Proof a Niçoise Salad
summary: This wintry mix of seared broccoli, new potatoes, tuna and olives focuses on produce procurable now. The recipe, from New Orleans chef John Sinclair, includes a garlicky aioli as easy to make as it is to love. DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE the power of a good sear. Look at what it does for broccoli. "People would like it more if it wasn't waterlogged mush every time," said chef John Sinclair. "I sear it instead. You get a range of textures, and you introduce all this flavor."

title: Bangladesh Inferno and Industrial Regulation
summary: Central Dhaka's population density is about 207,000 people a square mile, roughly eight times New York City's. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Bedding Brand Brooklinen Weighs a Capital Raise
summary: The venture capital-backed startup retained Citigroup Inc. to seek additional investors, said people familiar with the matter.. Popular bedding startup Brooklinen is hoping to tuck in new capital.

title: Barclays Counters Activist Investor Sherborne With 2018 Profit Growth
summary: Chief executive pledges to pay future dividends, buy back shares as Edward Bramson pushes for strategy changes. LONDON- Barclays PLC sought to fend off an activist investor Thursday with plans to buy back shares and a strong message that its current strategy is working.

title: Has Vermont Had It with Bernienomics?
summary: The state's voters love Bernie but not the results of his agenda.. Vermont's socialist Sen. Bernie Sanders has been pushing the national Democratic party to extremes. But his own constituents don't seem to want to come along for the ride leftward. As Mr. Sanders rolls out a plan to increase death taxes (among many other tax hikes he's proposing), a burgeoning movement in the Green Mountain State has been pursuing tax reform to stem the tide of fleeing Vermonters.

title: Today's Smartly Dressed People Are Wearing Sweatpants
summary: Karl Lagerfeld derided them. But a good pair of surrender jeans can be as cozy as koalas. Stylish people are mourning the loss of the legendary Chanel designer Karl Lagerfeld, who died Feb. 19 at age 85. Lagerfeld's influence on fashion was profound. He was also clever with a quote. "I am very much down to Earth," he once said. "Just not this Earth." Also: "Trendy is the last stage before tacky." And: "If you throw money out the window, throw it out with joy."

title: I Drove a Screaming Fast Ferrari Among Ordinary Cars
summary: The limited edition Ferrari 488 Pista can reach speeds of 211 mph. As Dan Neil discovered, you can't max it out on the Interstate but at least you'll turn some heads. AS GREAT DRIVING roads go, Interstate 10 isn't. The road between Phoenix and Los Angeles is nearly straight, almost featureless, an automotive conveyor belt through vault and valley 400 miles long. On some stretches the speed limit goes up to 75 mph, but last week, in my test car-a nuclear-tipped Ferrari 488 called the Pista-distance/time came to a droning standstill. My fellow travelers and I huddled together around 84 mph (the speed limit +9), hoping there would be safety in numbers. The desert scenery repeated like a cartoon backdrop. The tall saguaros mocked me.

title: IMF, Development Banks Agree to $10.2 Billion Bailout for Ecuador
summary: Latin American nation's economic growth has slowed amid lower oil prices, repayments to China. The International Monetary Fund and other development banks will bail out Ecuador as the South American nation struggles with weak economic growth and deficits.

title: Treasury to Sell $226 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department's auctions planned for next week range from 13-week bills to seven-year notes. The U.S. Treasury Department will auction $226 billion in securities next week, comprising $178 billion in new debt and $48 billion in previously sold debt. Details (all with minimum denominations of $100):

title: Smollett Charged With Giving False Police Report
summary: 'Empire' star said he was victim of a racist and antigay assault in Chicago. CHICAGO-Prosecutors on Wednesday charged actor Jussie Smollett with disorderly conduct for filing a false police report when he claimed to have been the victim of a racist and homophobic attack last month.

title: Oakland Teachers Go on Strike, Demand Big Pay Raises
summary: City's 3,000 teachers seek 12% retroactive raise, want the California district to hire more counselors, more full-time nurses. OAKLAND, Calif.-Teachers in Oakland went on strike Thursday in the country's latest walkout by educators over classroom conditions and pay.

title: Nigeria to Vote After Delay Brings New Conflict
summary: Disruption, fraud claims and threats of violence escalate during one-week postponement of presidential election. ABUJA, Nigeria-A surprise one-week delay in Nigeria's presidential election, now set for Saturday, has further complicated a fractious contest, bringing new fraud accusations, fresh fears of post-election violence, and disruptions that have cost Africa's largest economy an estimated $2 billion.

title: A Bel-Air Spec House With A Circular Pool Asks $48 Million
summary: A Los Angeles-based diamond manufacturer spent four years building a 20,000-square-foot mansion.. A Bel-Air spec home with a dramatic 200-foot circular infinity pool is coming on the market for $48 million.

title: The Muslim World Looks On as China Persecutes Its Muslims
summary: Governments that are quick to decry abuses elsewhere have hesitated to denounce the crackdown, fearing a loss of Chinese investment and support. When deadly riots between ethnic Uighurs and Han Chinese erupted in China's western region of Xinjiang in 2009, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan didn't mince words. "The incidents in China are, simply put, a genocide," he said as his industry minister called on Turks to boycott Chinese goods.

title: U.S. Existing Home Sales Drop 1.2% in January
summary: January marks the third consecutive month of declining sales, a sign that demand for housing continued to cool at the start of the year. WASHINGTON-Sales of previously owned homes fell in January, although a decline in home prices and mortgage rates could bode well for a pickup this spring.

title: SEC Joins List of Authorities Probing Money Laundering at Danske Bank
summary: The lender is also under investigation in Estonia, Denmark, the U.K. and France for allegedly facilitating the laundering of about $230 billion. title: Paris 2024 Organizers to Allow Public to Run the Marathon Course
summary: The mass start marathon would take place on the same day as the Olympic race, but wouldn't start at the same time as the elite competition. PARIS-Like every Olympic host, Paris was wondering how to make sure the general public would care about the Games. On Thursday, the 2024 organizing committee unveiled its revolutionary solution to the people: let them eat asphalt, by participating in the Olympic marathon.

title: Triplex Owned by Martha Stewart's Daughter Lists for $53 Million
summary: Alexis Stewart combined four units in a Richard Meier-designed building to create a 9,500-square-foot, six bedroom apartment in New York.. Alexis Stewart, media personality and daughter of Martha Stewart, is listing her sprawling triplex apartment in New York's West Village for $53 million.

title: Bunge May Sell Assets
summary: Grain-trading company, which reported a wider quarterly loss, was hurt by a drop in soybean prices. Bunge Ltd. said it is reviewing its businesses and may sell assets to improve profits at a volatile time for agricultural markets.

summary: After a fire destroyed their old home, a Fort Worth couple rebuilt with some inspiration from their eclectic collection of books, art and artifacts. title: What's the Hot Device in Startup Nation? The Fax Machine
summary: In Israel, with a booming tech sector, everyday business often remains low-tech. 'One foot in the future, one foot in the Bible.'. TEL AVIV-Aliza Landes commutes via electric scooter to a smartly decorated co-working space near Facebook 's Israeli headquarters. She works on lending and borrowing cryptocurrencies.

title: Business Investment Falters Amid Growing Global Economic Uncertainty
summary: Firms may be feeling less confident as trade tensions between the U.S. and trade partners heightened. WASHINGTON-A widely-watched measure of how much businesses are investing fell for the fourth time in five months at the end of 2018, signaling firms are feeling less confident in light of domestic and global economic uncertainty.

title: The Taste of Winter, Brewed and Bottled
summary: Why beers made with tree bark, sap and needles are what we want to drink right now. SEASONS HAVE their scents, and nothing conjures winter like a brisk whiff of the forest. Now, a new crop of beers infused with tree essences delivers woodsy aromas and rich flavors ideal for cold-weather drinking.

title: Bond Investors Shouldn't Fixate Too Much on the Alphabet
summary: Corporate debt graded BBB has become investors' bogeyman, but higher-rated paper isn't always safer. Just like a teapot that never whistles while you are looking at it, perhaps the most maligned bit of the corporate bond market isn't where investors will get burned.

title: Oscars 2019: Cast Your Ballot
summary: Vote for your favorites and see Wall Street Journal film critic Joe Morgenstern's top picks in our annual Oscar ballot. See his choices for key contests, and have your own say in our annual poll.

title: Land O'Lakes Looks Beyond Plain Butter
summary: As consumer tastes change, the company is expanding its product line. Among the offerings: butter with canola oil, calcium and vitamin D. Dairy farmers founded Land O'Lakes Inc. nearly a century ago to boost their sweet-cream butter sales. Now the Arden Hills, Minn., cooperative is looking beyond butter to help its 2,000 dairy members navigate tough times in the sector.

title: The Biggest Mistakes Companies Make With Hiring
summary: The most highly qualified and enthusiastic candidates too often get ignored. Companies often say people are their most important asset. But, for many, you'd never know it by the way they actually go about hiring those people.

title: Meet Under Armour CEO's Unusual Adviser: An MSNBC Anchor
summary: Kevin Plank flew journalist Stephanie Ruhle on private jet, took her advice on business issues, according to people familiar with the matter; board questioned CEO about ties. Kevin Plank has cultivated a wide circle of celebrities since founding Under Armour Inc. more than two decades ago. As the company has grown from a small startup to a global force in athletic apparel, some have even accompanied the chief executive on the private jet he leases to Under Armour.

title: Barclays Bats Off Activist With Buyback
summary: Returning capital is good way to silence critics even when the details are vague. Barclays has come up with an answer to the activist investor who wants big cuts to its investment bank. Trouble is that answer is pretty vague.

title: Syracuse's Jim Boeheim Strikes, Kills Pedestrian on Highway
summary: Police say Boeheim drove by and struck the 51-year-old man while trying to avoid the vehicle. SYRACUSE, N.Y.-Police say Syracuse men's basketball coach Jim Boeheim struck and killed a 51-year-old man walking outside his vehicle on a highway.

title: Textures That Delight and Disgust
summary: Flavor dominates the way we talk about food, but its 'mouthfeel' can be even more important. It's hard to eat a day-old bagel without a stab of disappointment: Few foods have a faster turnaround from mouthwatering to meh. A fresh bagel is irresistible, with its shiny-topped, chewy exterior and soft pillowy inside. A day-old bagel, on the other hand, is like a dull, carby workout for your jaws. No amount of cream cheese can rescue it.

title: U.S. Campaign Against Huawei Runs Aground in an Exploding Tech Market
summary: Resume Subscription. NEW DELHI-Washington has hit an unlikely roadblock in its extraordinary global push to sideline China's Huawei Technologies Co.: the world's biggest democracy, India.

title: Inheriting the Trauma of Genocide
summary: Research shows that atrocities witnessed by Tutsi survivors in Rwanda can leave marks on their children, born years later. A century ago, we called it shell shock-the legacy of trauma that wrought havoc on the bodies and minds of some World War I veterans. Today, when survivors of terrible events experience flashbacks and fears that disrupt their daily lives, long after the actual threat is gone, it is called post-traumatic stress disorder, or PTSD. Whatever you call it, we now know that direct exposure to extreme deprivation, violence, dislocation or torture can transform not only those who experience it but also their future offspring.

title: Schumer Questions Digital First's Hostile Bid for Gannett
summary: Senate minority leader says he's troubled by the company's history of slashing jobs and selling real-estate assets. A hostile takeover bid for America's largest newspaper group Gannett Co. by Digital First Media has taken a political turn, with the highest-ranking Senate Democrat demanding the potential acquirer explain its plans if a deal goes through.

title: The Life Story of Your Supermarket Chicken: Food Tracking Goes High-Tech
summary: From poultry monitors to berry-tracking blockchains, the food industry is adopting technology to meet our growing demand for information about what we eat. Supply-chain expert Robyn Metcalfe investigates. In "Farm," the pilot episode of the comedy series "Portlandia," a couple named Peter and Nance attempt to order chicken in a Portland restaurant. Their server, Dana, describes the pedigree and diet of the bird on the menu: "heritage breed," "woodland raised," "fed sheep's milk, soy and hazelnuts." Peter and Nance grill Dana about the chicken's organic bona fides. They review official papers describing Colin the chicken's origin and living conditions and then, still unsatisfied, they depart for the farm where Colin was raised to verify that he lived a happy, free-range life.

title: Why Are the Oscars So Long? (Hint: 24 Minutes of Walking)
summary: We watched 18 hours, 36 minutes and four seconds of Oscar telecasts to figure out why. Last year's Oscars show was the longest telecast in years, and also the lowest-rated one ever. Coincidence? Doubtful.

title: What's It Take to Sell a Home on Chicago's Lake Michigan? Patience
summary: Resume Subscription. Many older waterfront homes currently for sale on suburban Chicago's North Shore feature views of majestic Lake Michigan, access to sandy beaches and glimpses of migrating birds and other wildlife. What these homes don't have, however, is buyers.

title: Pope Denounces Sex-Abuse 'Plague' Amid Pressure for Reforms
summary: Pope Francis pushes for concrete and effective measures to prevent clerical sex abuse. VATICAN CITY-Pope Francis denounced a "plague of sexual abuses perpetrated by men of the church to the harm of minors," and called on Catholic bishops to "listen to the cry of the little ones who plead for justice," as he opened a four-day summit on preventing clerical sex abuse.

title: In Charged Political Climate, Best Picture Oscar Is About More Than the Movie
summary: Factions behind 'Black Panther,' 'Green Book,' 'Bohemian Rhapsody' and other best-picture nominees look past the films to what they represent. In the 2019 Oscar race for best picture, a vote for a film has become a vote for a cause.

title: Six Tie-Dye Items to Add Spring Wardrobe Whimsy
summary: The pattern takes a witty approach with looks that add more fun than funk. A subtle version of the trend, this tunic pairs easily with jeans and your favorite sunnies. Price upon request, 800-929-DIOR

title: Diana Athill, Crushed by an Early Love Affair, Rewrote Herself a Happier Ending
summary: English author found her bearings in middle age as a book editor and writer of remarkably frank memoirs. For anyone whose heart was ever shattered at a young age, Diana Athill offered hope: Things would get better, eventually.

title: Trump Inaugural Committee Challenged Vendor Requests and Budgeting
summary: Paperwork is in hands of federal prosecutors, who are investigating payments to vendors. In the weeks before his inauguration, top officials on President Trump's inaugural committee repeatedly sounded alarms about the budgets submitted by several vendors, according to correspondence, committee records and draft budgets reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: 'I'm Not Afraid to Die for This': Venezuelans on the Fight for Their Country
summary: Resume Subscription. Struggling to survive the world's highest inflation and severe shortages of food and medicine, Venezuelans have been watching an extraordinary standoff between authoritarian President Nicolás Maduro and the U.S.-backed opposition leader Juan Guaidó, who has claimed to be the country's interim president. In recent interviews, Venezuelans in the capital Caracas discussed why they are supporting Mr. Maduro or Mr. Guaidó and what they are doing to get by.

title: Methodist Church Faces Possible Schism on Gay Rights
summary: Nation's second-largest Protestant denomination gathers this week in search of compromise, but some activists want a split. The United Methodist Church is on the precipice of a schism as its leaders gather this week in search of a way to end decades of rancor over rights for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people.

title: Stocks to Watch: Hormel Foods, Bunge, Newmont
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Thursday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fell Last Week
summary: Initial claims, a proxy for layoffs across the U.S., decreased by 23,000. WASHINGTON-The number of Americans filing applications for new unemployment benefits fell last week, a signal of labor market tightness.

title: Wary Investors Reach for Gold
summary: Gold prices have climbed as investors uncertain about global growth outlook hedge their portfolios. Investors are buying gold again as concerns about a slowing global economy are putting a premium on safer investments.

title: New Samsung Phone Folds in Half, and Costs Nearly $2,000
summary: No. 1 smartphone maker also unveils four Galaxy S10 models, seeking wider swath of consumers. SAN FRANCISCO- Samsung Electronics Co. unveiled the industry's first mainstream foldable-screen smartphone on Wednesday, in a radical design change that shakes up the ubiquitous device's aesthetic-but also sends the industry's pricing model soaring to new heights.

title: Yikes, His Nikes! Zion Williamson's Sneaker Disaster
summary: A college basketball sensation is derailed by a shoe blowout during Duke vs. Carolina. You gotta watch Zion Williamson, everyone said. He does things you've never seen in college basketball before.

title: Anglo American Boosts Profit and Cuts Debt Amid Turnaround
summary: Mining companies are bracing for increased safety regulations following the fatal bursting of a dam in Brazil. Mining giant Anglo American PLC reported a rise in profit, capitalizing on higher commodities prices and a yearslong overhaul that helped it recover from near-crisis a little more than three years ago.

title: New York Property Firm Hit the Jackpot. Then Amazon Pulled Out.
summary: 'Every deal was contingent on Amazon.' Retailer's pull out from Queens scuttled New York property firm's plans to refinance and sell stakes in Long Island City building. There may be nobody who lost more from Amazon.com Inc.'s pull out of Queens than the real-estate investors at Savanna.

title: Apple, Goldman Sachs Team Up on Credit Card Paired With iPhone
summary: Both companies are seeking new revenue sources as their bread-and-butter businesses struggle. Apple Inc. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. plan to start issuing this spring a joint credit card paired with new iPhone features that will help users manage their money.

title: Malaysia Orders Arrest of Ex-Leader Najib's Former Media Adviser
summary: Money-laundering charges have been filed against Paul Stadlen relating to bank transfers totaling $3.5 million. KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia-A British national who worked as a media adviser to former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak is facing two counts of money-laundering charges over $3.5 million that was allegedly linked to his former boss, a government prosecutor said Thursday.

title: China Tightens Grip on East African Port
summary: Beijing state giants take control of Djibouti's trading gateway at an ocean-going crossroads between Asia and Europe. A Chinese port operator is tightening its grip on a strategic container terminal in East Africa, resetting operations and infrastructure at a site crucial to Beijing's push to control seagoing trade lanes between Asia and Europe.

title: Standard Chartered Books $900 Million Provision for Potential Settlements
summary: Asia-focused bank is in talks with U.S. authorities over an investigation related to sanctions on Iran. LONDON- Standard Chartered PLC said Thursday it would take a $900 million charge to cover conduct-related settlements, including the potential resolution of a U.S. sanctions probe that has hung over the bank.

title: Australian Dollar Drops on Report of a Chinese Port's Coal Ban
summary: News report says Dalian port has imposed indefinite ban on imports of Australian coal. The Australian dollar dropped as much as 1.1% on Thursday after a news report said China's Dalian port had banned imports of Australian coal.

title: Russia Exploits U.S.-China Trade Tensions to Sell More Soybeans
summary: Commercial conflict has choked American soy exports to the bean's biggest market, China, providing Russian farmers an opportunity. RAZDOLNOE, Russia-The Partizan collective farm in this Siberian village should have been swept into the dustbin of history like thousands of others like it that collapsed after the Soviet Union's fall. Instead it just raked in the biggest harvest of its 90-year history, bought new machines and paid out record bonuses.

title: Warren Buffett Can't Find Anything Big to Buy
summary: Investors are hoping his annual letter to Berkshire's shareholders will offer hints on plans to spend its cash. Warren Buffett is always on the hunt for "elephants," as he calls large acquisitions. But three years have passed since he bagged a new one.

title: Apple to Chinese Consumers: Buy a New iPhone for Under $30 a Month, Interest Free
summary: To boost flagging sales, Apple is making sure the price is right for customers in China. Apple Inc., hoping to revitalize sales in China, has paired up with the world's largest financial-technology company to give iPhone buyers an affordable purchase option: up to two years of interest-free financing.

title: The World's Largest PC Maker Is No Longer a Bargain
summary: Lenovo's shares have been on a tear-but as consumers slow their purchases, the momentum will be hard to maintain. Lenovo 's latest reboot seems to have worked pretty well after a yearslong crash. Investors should wonder how long it can last.

title: Ant Financial's Alipay to Impose Fees on Some Users as Costs Mount
summary: Alipay has had to comply with tighter financial regulations in China over the past year. Chinese mobile-payment giant Alipay said it would start imposing fees on certain customers who use its network to pay down credit card debt, in an effort to recoup some of its increasing costs.

title: The Global Trade Slowdown Will Get Worse Before It Gets Better
summary: Surprisingly strong Chinese trade data for January are looking like an outlier, given this week's soggy numbers from Japan and Korea. A week is a long time in global trade, apparently. Weak data from Japan and Korea this week suggest stronger-than-expected January trade numbers from China released last week were a blip. For investors focused on the outcome of U.S.-China trade talks, the message is clear: Pay more attention to the global slump that's already under way.

title: Iranian Group Blamed for Cyberattack on Australia's Parliament
summary: Attack is compatible with the activity of an Iranian state actor, U.S. cyber research company alleges. CANBERRA, Australia-Hackers based in Iran and implicated in attacks on the U.S. and Western allies were behind a computer breach of Australia's Parliament and political parties, a U.S. cyber research company alleged.

title: WHO Reacts to Chinese Gene-Edited Twins With Plan for Global Guidelines
summary: Group's 18-member committee of scientific experts, which includes a Chinese bioethicist, will meet in Geneva next month. The World Health Organization established a new committee to set guidelines for scientists editing human DNA, just months after the controversial births of the world's first gene-edited babies in China.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: China Starts the Year With a Corporate Bond Boom
summary: Companies have issued $159.2 billion worth of bonds this year. Companies have rushed to sell new bonds in China this year, as Beijing loosens financial conditions to shore up businesses in a weakening economy.

title: Coast Guard Lieutenant Arrested in Alleged Domestic Terror Plot
summary: Authorities said they found more than a dozen firearms, ammunition and a hit list of Democratic lawmakers, activists and media personalities. WASHINGTON-A U.S. Coast Guard lieutenant and self-described white nationalist was arrested after authorities said they found more than a dozen firearms, ammunition and a hit list of Democratic lawmakers, activists and media personalities in his Maryland home.

title: Trump Administration Moves to Block Return of U.S.-Born Woman Who Joined Islamic State
summary: State Department disputes Alabama woman's citizenship as her family vows legal challenge. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration refused to allow a U.S.-born woman who joined Islamic State in Syria to return to the U.S., arguing Wednesday that she isn't an American citizen and prompting her family to prepare a legal challenge.

title: Pelosi Says House Will Move Swiftly to Block Trump's Emergency on Wall
summary: Speaker says president's declaration 'undermines the separation of powers and Congress's power of the purse'. WASHINGTON-Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday said the House would "swiftly" pass a measure that would block President Trump's national emergency order to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, setting the stage for a vote in that chamber followed by a fierce debate in the GOP-controlled Senate.

title: Congressional Candidate's Son Testifies About Potential Fraud
summary: Mark Harris's son said he warned the North Carolina Republican against hiring a contractor who has been accused of unlawfully collecting absentee ballots. RALEIGH, N.C.-The son of Republican Mark Harris, who is vying for the nation's last undecided congressional seat, said Wednesday he repeatedly warned his father against hiring a contractor who has been accused of unlawfully collecting absentee ballots.

title: Michael Cohen to Testify at Open House Hearing Feb. 27
summary: Fixer expected to lay out tale of breaking with president and implicating him in crimes. WASHINGTON-Michael Cohen, a former lawyer for President Trump, has agreed to testify publicly before the House Oversight Committee on Feb. 27, in what is expected to be an explosive hearing focused on his decade of working for the president.

title: New Details of Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway, JPMorgan Health Venture Emerge in Court Testimony
summary: Operating Chief Jack Stoddard says venture is focusing on the complexity of health insurance, in newly unsealed testimony. BOSTON-A health-care joint venture launched by Amazon.com Inc., Berkshire Hathaway Inc. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. is looking at how to redesign health insurance, among other efforts, according to newly unsealed court testimony from an executive at the health startup.

title: 'Stealing Flowers Is Not Really Stealing': Thieves Pick From a $35 Billion Garden
summary: China spends billions on trees, shrubs and flowers to spruce up concrete cities. Some see beauty. Others see a bounty of black-market cash.. Three lollipop-shaped hybrid Chinese ash trees, imported from Italy, recently vanished from a street in Wuhan, a city in central China. Each one of the 7-footers was worth about $500.

title: Johnson & Johnson Is Subpoenaed for Talc Safety Information
summary: Company says inquiries relate to news reports about product-liability litigation; safety of Baby Powder has been at issue. Johnson & Johnson said Wednesday it received subpoenas from the U.S. Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission seeking documents related to the safety of its signature baby powder and other talc-containing products.

title: Trump, Xi Face Pressure at Home Over Trade
summary: Concerns are rising at home that Xi Jinping and President Trump will try to make a quick deal. WASHINGTON-Despite their sharp differences in style, background and policies, Chinese leader Xi Jinping and President Trump share a common problem: growing concerns on the home front that they are going to cave in to the other side.

title: Justices Against Unjust Forfeiture
summary: The Supreme Court says state seizures can violate the Constitution.. Police and prosecutors around America have long used asset forfeiture as a cash cow, but a unanimous Supreme Court ruling Wednesday should make them think twice. The Bill of Rights keeps paying dividends even after 228 years.

title: A Partial Payday Reprieve
summary: The CFPB moves to help people get cash in a pinch.. The Obama Administration too often crushed legal industries that aren't politically fashionable-for-profit colleges, for instance. So it's welcome news that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is unwinding parts of a needlessly punitive rule on payday lenders, though a wholesale rewrite would be better.

title: Trump Rescues Newsom
summary: Too bad the feds didn't cut off California's bullet train sooner..

title: Brazil's President Unveils Pension-Overhaul Plan, in a Key Test
summary: Plan seeks to cut $289.5 billion in costs for a system that serves 21 million people. SÃO PAULO-Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro unveiled his long-awaited proposal for overhauling the country's insolvent pension system, setting up a major political test as he attempts to avert a financial crisis in Latin America's biggest economy.

title: Canyon Capital Turns to Proxy Fight After Navient Rejects Proposal
summary: Hedge fund says it will propose a minority slate of candidates for election at company's annual meeting. Hedge Fund Canyon Capital Advisors LLC said Wednesday that is plans to launch to a proxy fight with Navient Corp. and that it has withdrawn its interest in acquiring the student-loan servicer.
